p: While SARS-CoV usually infects the youngest (Luk et al. 2019), MERS-CoV targets people aged > 50Â years (Yin and Wunderink 2018), and COVID-19 infects middle-aged groups and above (Phan 2020). Comparing non-respiratory complications, MERS-CoV involves the cardiovascular system more frequently than SARS-CoV and frequently requires vasopressor treatment (Cui et al. 2019; Yin and Wunderink 2018). On the other hand, some case reports have shown that COVID-19 affects the cardiovascular system (Lu et al. 2020; Cao et al. 2020). Acute kidney failure was more frequently observed in SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV epidemics compared with COVID-19 cases (Farooq et al. 2020; Luk et al. 2019). Whereas radiologic findings are present in all three pathogens, airspace opacifications are seen in SARS-CoV and a ground-glass appearance in MERS-CoV and COVID-19 (Yin and Wunderink 2018; Jin et al. 2020).
